newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Banks freeze checking accounts for Sammi.
newsitem.headline: Banks freeze checking accounts for Sammi.

text.p: Banks on Thursday froze checking accounts for South Korea's Sammi Steel Co, which had defaulted on promissory note payments, the Korea Financial Telecommunications and Clearings Institute said.
Sammi Steel, South Korea's largest stainless steel maker, has failed to honour repayments of promissory notes worth 1.8 billion won.
"As the company could not pay the notes, its bank transactions were frozen from today," said an official at the clearings house.
Sammi Steel sought protection from its creditors on Tuesday along with other affiliates of Sammi Group, South Korea's 26th largest conglomerate.
After the news, Sammi's prime creditor bank, the Korea First Bank, said it would not supply additional funds to the troubled company.
Sammi Steel had liabilities of 1.45 trillion won at the end of 1996 against assets of 1.53 trillion won, according to company figures.
